definition: to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: But that is the effect of relative dollar depreciation.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這卻是美元相對貶值的實際結果。

sentences.english: And I'm convinced self-depreciation goes right to the heart of our financial ruts.
sentences.chinese: 我確信自我貶值促成了我們理財習慣的核心。

sentences.english: Traditional schoolbook says inflation will cause devaluation.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的教科書說通貨膨脹將導致貨幣貶值。

sentences.english: The value of money lessens during inflation.
sentences.chinese: 通貨膨漲期間貨幣貶值。

sentences.english: Now, the costs of devaluing appear prohibitively high.
sentences.chinese: 現在，貶值貨幣的代價看起來高得讓人望而怯步。

sentences.english: " working without pay", could it be that the undergraduates devalued?
sentences.chinese: “零工資就業”，大學生真的貶值了？

sentences.english: In that regard, Liu said USD depreciation is also a concern.
sentences.chinese: 由是觀之，劉也表示，美元的貶值也是疑慮之一。

sentences.english: Appreciation against a falling dollar leaves the yuan little changed on a trade-weighted basis.
sentences.chinese: 對貶值中的美元升值，貿易加權匯率就沒有什麼變化。

sentences.english: On a trade-weighted basis, the dollar has fallen by around 10% over the past six months.
sentences.chinese: 以貿易加權計算，美元在過去六個月貶值了約10%。

sentences.english: But a home does not depreciate in this way, and can be resold many times.
sentences.chinese: 但是房子就不會這樣輕易貶值，並且能夠多次出售。

sentences.english: A person with a discerning eye looks devalue, this statement points to continuously long swim.
sentences.chinese: 明眼人一看貶值，此聲明直指久遊。

sentences.english: Even white truffles , the prized culinary delicacy, could not escape the slump.
sentences.chinese: 即便是食中珍饈松露也難逃貶值的命運。

sentences.english: Hanke says the weak U.S. dollar does not help matters.
sentences.chinese: 漢克說，美元貶值對問題不會有幫助作用。

sentences.english: The country devalued its currency by 5 percent.
That devalues both the outcome and the student.
sentences.chinese: 這將使最終成果和學生都大大貶值。

sentences.english: In the modern context, that would mean devaluing the yen.
sentences.chinese: 在當前的背景下，就意味着使日元貶值。

definition: to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
